results.definition: designed for or capable of a particular function or use
examples: a style of writing in which every word is functional

results.definition: involving or affecting function rather than physiology
relating to or based on function especially as opposed to structure; it is a functional one"
examples: the problem now is not a constitutional one
delegates elected on a functional rather than a geographical basis

results.definition: fit or ready for use or service
examples: the toaster was still functional even after being dropped
the lawnmower is a bit rusty but still usable
the dishwasher is now in working order

results.definition: designed for or adapted to a function or use
examples: functional education selects knowledge that is concrete and usable rather than abstract and theoretical

results.definition: (of e.g. a machine) performing or capable of performing
